newsitem.title: FRANCE: Renault workers protest plant closure.
newsitem.headline: Renault workers protest plant closure.

text.p: Workers from Renault's assembly plant in Vilvoorde, Belgium, mounted scattered protests in France on Thursday against the French carmaker's plans to close down the plant, threatening 3,100 jobs.

Several dozen workers who drove to Paris from Belgium marched down the Champs-Elysees boulevard after demonstrating in front of Renault headquarters in suburban Paris where the board was meeting for a briefing on the firm's 1996 results.
Analysts predicted Renault would announce losses for the year of 4.5 billion to six billion francs.
The demonstrations were staged a day after Renault chairman Louis Schweitzer reaffirmed the company's 's decision to shut down the Vilvoorde plant.
Union officials afterward vowed to step up protests against the decision, saying that Schweitzer had rejected their ideas on how to keep the plant operating.
